reviewText: amazing value three movies for under 5 dollars. scooby has a great winter collection that I have passed on to my nephews. Tom and jerry has their own separate disc of a great holiday collection of cartoons. The looney tunes movie is the reason why I bought this DVD and is well worth it. it is both heart warming and funny. a must see holiday film

This 3-disc DVD holiday release will just contain 3 DVD releases (featuring Tom & Jerry, Scooby Doo, and the Looney Tunes) that were released a long time ago. But it's not that bad of a release, but not worth it if you already have the original DVD releases. I mostly recommend this for families and children who want to buy this for the holidays.

Contains:
Tom and Jerry: Paws for a Holiday (2003)
  *Mice Follies (1954)
  *Designs on Jerry (1955)
  *The Tom and Jerry Cartoon Kit (1962)
  *Snowboy Loves Me (1964)
  *I'm Just Wild About Jerry (1965)
  *The A-Tom-Inable Snowman (1966)
  *Advance and Be Mechanized (1967)

Scooby-Doo: Winter Wonderdog (2002)
  *The Nutcracker Scoob (ep. 26 of The New Scooby-Doo Mysteries)
  *Alaskan King Coward (from ep. 8 of The Richie Rich/Scooby-Doo Show)
  *A Scary Night with a Snow Beast Fright (ep. 32 of Scooby-Doo, Where Are You! season 3/The Scooby-Doo Show)
  *That's Snow Ghost (ep. 17 of Scooby-Doo, Where Are You! season 1)

Bah, Humduck! A Looney Tunes Christmas (2006 direct-to-video movie)
